Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Here begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, sons, if you have completed this book, which is the last of the science of medicine, for the completion of its purpose, and for its explanations, and for its declarations, I consider that you have completed this treatise, which is part of surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	The operation of castration has been entirely neglected in our region and time, until recently the science of it was unknown, and its proof is still hidden; and no one knows about it except a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which are lost and have led to errors and uncertainty until the understanding of it is closed and its power is prolonged and the art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I see that you will live by this order of the treatise in the second way of explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and because it comes with the forms of the tools of cauterization and other instruments of the work as it is for addition to the declaration, and for its preparation, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	In ancient times, the reason why a skilled artist was not immediately recognized as such in our time is because the art of medicine is long and complicated, and it requires one to be exercised in the science of anatomy, which was recently discovered by Galen before he knew the usefulness of the members and their forms; and also knowing the bones, nerves, and ligaments, and the number of them, and their hardness; and the pulsating veins, quiet veins, and the locations of their emissions.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason, Hippocrates said that a name is not necessary, but in the work itself, and more so in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	Moreover, we have already mentioned this in the introduction of this book; for those who do not know what we have said about anatomy, will not be able to avoid error by which many men die, as I have seen too many of them, because they are formed in this science and get their knowledge from that science and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	When a doctor was folly enough to have incurred an abscess called phlegmon in the neck of a woman, and incised some arteries of the neck so that much blood flowed into the woman, causing her to die between them.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And another doctor saw that the dragger had taken a stone from a man who had suffered from it in his state, and the stone was large, and he came to him and tried to remove that stone with a trocar, so that that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And he had already called for someone to extract that, and saw that due to the size of the stone and the position of the patient, it was impossible to save him.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And another doctor who took a fee from a duke of our land for surgery, and went to a very skilled blacksmith who was needed for the fracture in the joint of him; and because of his ignorance, he extracted the fracture, on the plate, with pulleys and levers of strong structure, and did not allow the plate to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then remove the bedclothes according to his desires, and remove the reins, and remove the leeches for several days and order that he be bled; and while the cushion and foot are infected with apostematous pus, and reach perdition.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And then he was called to it, and prepared to remove the bandage, and thus obtained peace and relief from his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, gangrene was already confirmed in the member, so it could not be restrained from that one, and did not cease to spread the gangrene in the member until the patient died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And another doctor came who pierced an apostematic cancer, and it became ulcerous after several days, until the fire magnified the evil of him and he died.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of which is that the cranium is cleansed of melancholic humor, so that it does not reach him with iron from all sides, but rather that the member that suffers be held from all sides.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	For that reason, sons, it is necessary for you to divide the operation into two parts: one in which health is associated, and another in which the work is done in the best possible conditions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already seen that in all places where this book is found, in which the operation is performed with error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to guard against that and lay aside that one, so that people do not come to speak badly of you and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take up your weapons with solicitude and protection of God, and your patients with success and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best method for the grace of God to lead to salvation and praiseworthy succession, and lay aside the terrible diseases of difficult healing, and keep your weapons from that which makes you afraid, so that your faith and name do not abandon you: for more remains to your glory, and further in the world and behind in your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	In some of his writings, he mentions:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	He does not mention the treatment of bad patients, because bad doctors do not remember.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already dedicated this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The beginning of the division of the book, and the first of the first section.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered by the foot, in the forms of instruments and in the handles of cauteries, and of what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second section.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of drying and perforation, and of ventilations, and of plasters, and of the extraction of worms and similar to those, all chapter ordered and arranged by the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third section.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, of restoration and of dislocation, and of the cure of tortion and similar to those; chapter ordered by the foot, and by the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of a pointed cautery and sharp medicine and remembrance of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In that part begins the treatise on all free.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	That you know the quality of those joints of that cautery and of its handles, and in what condition it is prohibited to use the cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the speech about the quality of the joint of the cautery and of its handle is a long and prolix, and subtle for those who know, and secretly hidden; and from there they have spoken much about wisdoms, and of them they have disagreed, and to me it is a small part of their speeches, I fear for the length.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that the cautery compares to all universal condition, which is matter or its matter, except for two conditions, which are conditions of the tail matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the condition of the tail and dry matter they disagree; for one said that the cautery is suitable for that, and the others said the contrary of that, which is not convenient in illness which is due to quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is not convenient that illness tail and dry matter has that which is cauterized and dry is healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And say to that one who says the opposite of that one, that cauterization is greatly beneficial in all sickness and dryness that occurs in the bodies of men, because when you compare the body of a man with the moisture of it to the appearance of the fire, the body of a man is wet.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the word of that one, that he has experimented this for me several times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But he may not come over that one who has already been proven and exercised in the capital of cauterization by previous exercise, and who knows the diversity of the appearance of men and the disposition of their diseases in their members, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the space of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other appearances, you do not fear that one, and especially in diseases that are wet and moist, because all doctors have agreed on those, and they do not disagree in the benefit of cauterization in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my children, that the secret of healing by fire and its goodness is that by cauterization with fire, because the fire is simple, the action of which does not reach beyond the member that is cauterized and does not hurt the other member unless it is adjusted slightly without causing harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	When the action of medicine has reached those parts of the body that were previously affected, and it brings pain to the sick member, it is difficult to heal and often causes more harm.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	However, fire, due to its great power and good substance, does not cause this but rather an excess, and we have known this through experiment and the length of time it has been studied as an art over the truth of causes; and for this reason you are excused from the length of this speech. If not, if it is not read aloud in this pause, and the quality of its operation in the bodies and its expulsion by which it expels evils, the philosophical demonstration of speech, which would be sharpened in your thoughts.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they should not be separated from the time in which it is appropriate to make a cautery and pause at the best time of primevera.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cautery is appropriate at all times, because the harm caused by time is submerged in the benefit of which the cautery is thrown, and more so if the cautery is for pain or necessary pain, quickly and firmly, which would not suffer delay because it is feared that those who come with malice are greater than small harm coming through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And if you do not catheterize in your feet, or, sons, that is only estimated by the common people and foolish doctors, so it is not always necessary to treat that malady with cauterization, and they stop that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not always present that they fear for that, because cauterization is only in a place of medicine which alters the appearance and dries the moisture, which are the cause of why pain comes.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But however, cauterization is often used in medicine for the sake of its value and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his malady returns in some time of the day, according to the appearance of the patient and the location of his malady, and its virtue, and that which is prepared in the body of him from the aggregation of the superfluities in him, and that which is obtained by him in his acquisition of foods and similar causes; but the malady in which cauterization is administered is a subtle malady of few superfluities and moisture, such as toothache for pain and similar to that, possible it does not return in him, but that which is done in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	More commonly, the pointed cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is the correct term, not what I understand in it, because they believe that there is no cure that can be achieved by this medicine or by another cause to use a cauterizing needle.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The cause is in the opposite; and they understand that the pointed cautery is the last remedy of medicine is only when administering methods of treatment in some diseases, and those medicines do not help, and at the end of the cause, they administer a cauterizing needle, and it helps to that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here it is understood that the pointed cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not what they understand among the common people and too many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that gold is better than iron for cauterizing, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the superiority of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place for cauterizing does not hurt, because it is not absolutely true, since I have already seen that there are some people who do not feel pain from that which does not make them sick in other bodies, and cauterizing with gold is good and better than iron, but however when you make cauterizing with fire made of gold, it is not to your declaration, because it is determined according to the quantity that you want for the roughness of the gold, and because it prepares to receive the frost; and if you adjust over the fire, the gold melts by the heat, and in the fire some layers for which the craftsman cooks for the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for that, a pointed cautery of iron is made to us more lightly and more directly to the straightness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on the second chapter of the cautery, and have ordered those who are in the head between the feet, so that they ask him what he wants from him.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cauteries for head pain due to cold and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization gives to the moisture and cold of the head, which are causes of many accidents, called corissa, from the head to the parts of the limbs and of the jaws fluent, and many of sleep, and of tooth pain and of gout, and universally of all illness that comes from cold, such as paralysis, sudden and apoplexy, and similar in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: first, commands the patient that he be evacuated by a laxative medicine to clean his head, for three or four nights, according to the patient's virtue and age and custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command the one who holds their head to shave it, and then make that person sit on a chair and place their hands on their chest.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the razor blade on the palm of your hand and hold it above the nose between their nostrils.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, since the location you mentioned is not reachable, mark that location and then use the pointed cautery of this form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that on the location and apply pressure slowly, so that it is not too tight, and you rotate that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then slightly raise your hand and look at the location, and if you see that some of the bone has been exposed, in the same amount as the amount of hair, then raise your hand, and if it does not return to its place, then bring your hand back to that iron, or another one of those, if it is cold, before you can see that which I have told you about.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt and dissolve it on the location and leave that for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place your hand on the flat part of their back and hold it over the area where the bone of the fire is to be destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the four-ingredient ointment into the wound until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they say that when the plague is opened, as much milk as possible should be poured into it, so that it is better and more healing.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they said that the spine should be cauterized into the bone, and it should be held with the cautery until some part of the bone is adhered to.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove that which has adhered to the bone, and then heal it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And they said that others used the cautery to reach the back, until it strongly entered into the bone before it broke, and this is the way to make a small incision:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they estimated that from that wound, the vapors of the head escaped.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then healed until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these two types of cauteries in all men, but only in those who have had the second stage of fear; and if you leave that one, it is better for your health when it is, because the head is revealed by the solution of continuity of it with what we have testified in other members, and more so when the head of the patient is of a fragile nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first type of cautery is more safe and better for me; and from that one, you should choose the one that is more beneficial for your health.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When the entire head is affected by chronic and long-lasting pain, and that is prolonged in the patient, and uses of garlic, of charcoal, of capicum, of purges, of ointments, of galbanum, of wax, and of similar things, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery that they have and not improved at all from those causes, then consider that if the head of the patient is of strong creation in its nature; and not fragile and easily broken, then that cautery should be applied again.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then apply a pointed cautery on the horn of his head inside where the bone is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the bone and discover the amount of bone that we have found and cauterize that with a cautery on the part behind the head in the place where the pus is located - and that is the place where the pus is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And let your hand rest, and do not cut the bone, because the patient will suffer from that very great pain different from all other head cautery pains.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say that this cautery is in this place, because it covers the horn of the head and the back of the head is a more subtle cautery than that which is cauterized at the middle of the head; and this is the shape of it.
Capitol ters.	Third chapter.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the ancient non-antiquated cautery of the eyebrow.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When pain occurs in the part of the head, or is felt inside the eye, remove the medicines that make the head clear, and administer the other cure, which I have mentioned in the treatises on diseases; and if it does not work, then cauterization is done in two ways: either with a sharp cautery or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	May the pointed cautery be used as a medical tool to hold a painful object and scrape it with an open cap on its ends and cover its extremities with ointment.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then, incise the location of the pain in the temple with a blade that is inserted into its fitting place behind the ear, where it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then, strengthen it with a stopper due to constant compression, and leave it for three hours; then remove the alh, and let the wound rest for two or three days, and then place a bandage on the location where the pain occurs.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then, cure it with an ointment that is inserted into its fitting place when it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do that with some medical tools that I have written about in the other treatise on medical tools.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	May the cauterization be done in this manner: light a cautery of this form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a clover-shaped cautery, where the head of it is shaped like a clover with some curvature, and in its middle part there is a small pinpoint.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place your hand on the location of the pain, and remove your hand — so that the wound is not closed prematurely — and slowly turn the small iron at speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of blood that is stopped by the skill of the surgeon is such that it covers the entire body, and lift your hand to prevent the artery from being closed prematurely, so that no bleeding occurs.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a piece of saltwater cloth on that location, and leave it for three days; and then apply a warm compress, and then care for the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, cauterize the tip of the lancet according to the cautery, and avoid injury to the artery in this unskilled manner.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the ancient method of cauterization.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat the wound with the method we mentioned in the previous cure, and with the method we mentioned in the division of diseases, and if the cure does not improve, and you see that the disease does not respond to the first cauterization with medicine or the cauterization with fire, then wait until the cauterization is healed, so that it does not cover the location of the pain with a long line that covers the entire body, or that it does not penetrate the flesh. Then place your hand firmly and quickly enter the incision and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to guard against the continuity of the mandible, which is often injured during chewing, and that the jaw does not become stuck and the nerves that are affected by it, and that it does not become spasmodic.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the guard and care of the flow of blood from the artery that is being blocked, where in its blockage there is fear and more so for those who do not know what to do and are not skilled; and leave the operation to begin.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you should remember the regimen of blood flow accidents of the artery according to its method, in its own location of this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this disease that does not allow this cautery and you feel the patient's pain tolerably, cauterize that in the middle of the head as we have reported, and cure the wound before it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you apply the cautery that we have mentioned in the chapter of artery stretching, which has two points, and this cauterization is better and more suitable.
Capitol .v.	Chapter Five
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	About the cauterization of the pains of gout.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain in the big toe occurs due to cold humors and is cured by laxatives and the other treatment mentioned in the previous section, and the pain does not disappear, then ignite the cautery, and this is the one that has no puncture, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then approach the puncture with the ignition, and place it around the entire big toe as if it were rotated, or in the circumference of each one where the pain is in each one.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Following the cautery, gradually move it around the base of the big toe until you have tried enough to reach the location.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of these points in the entire big toe, and it does not find it, and then cure the locations before they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter Six
De cauterizacio de turtura.	About the cauterization of torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture that is cured and is not treated by cauterization except for the specific ones that come from inflammation, as we have said in the sections of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid the use of dry or spasm-inducing cautery on the affected area.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that type of torture caused by jerks and caprice and guarding, and you do not combine your treatment, then you should use three types of cautery: the first is the point of a gold needle, the second is a small one next to the temple, and the third is at the conjunction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the affected area, as softening is only seen on the healthy side.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cautery is to cauterize that one with the cautery on the right side of the gold needle, a small one above the little toe, and in the temple another, the longest of which should be second to the length of the said gold needle, and place your hand over the cautery until the quantity of the most part of the species of the codex is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is specific to the cuttlefish, the form of which is given in the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	May it be, however, that there is less skill in that one; and cover the area with a cloth to prevent excessive grease from soiling it.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then carefully clean the area where the procedure was performed until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of ancient cautery for apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When ancient apoplexy is treated with the methods mentioned earlier and the patient does not have a fever, then apply four cautery points: on the entire surface of the head; and at the back of the head, as we have mentioned; and at the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	The method of applying the cautery is done as described above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and more is done later; and then carefully clean the area where the procedure was performed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cautery for forgetfulness caused by flaccidity.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Give large amounts of water and flatulent medicines to the patient at the beginning of the treatment.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then remove the cap from the patient's head and place it on the described plaster in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	Then place some bandages on that, which is the method of cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	Do the same as the previous method, which has already been mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	If those methods do not work; then make three cautery points on the back part of his head, which should be placed between the most elevated part of the head and the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Place the largest amount of the mentioned remedy between each cautery, and then care for the cautery as it proceeds.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If you feel pain and the patient tolerates it, then make the cautery in the middle location; and if you feel more pain, then make the cautery on both feet.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Care for that until it is healed; and if the cautery is made with olive oil, follow the form given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter Nine
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cauterization of the perineum and the softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	You have already processed in the softening of the head and that which we have said; and then shave the head of the patient, and then apply the cautery at the middle part of the head, and apply the cautery on all the corners of the head, and apply the cautery on the back part of it, and three cauteries on the spine of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the illness of softening of the body for three people and the patients endure well and the illness is strong, then apply the cautery on four spines of the back, and afterwards apply the cautery through that which is covered by the collar of the patient, and lift the upper arm.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then care for that which is healed, and this be cautery olive oil.
Capitol .x.	Chapter Ten
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized, but that epilepsy which is by flexibility.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore, at the beginning of the illness and on the other side of the cure, which we have mentioned in the division when the patient is large and tolerates the exception of the medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is an infant who does not suffer the medicines, then administer ginger and mustard to those who are modifying, giving that for several days, good improvement of the foods.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize that with a cauterizer in the middle of the patient's forehead according to the previous method, and with another cauterizer on the back of their head, and over each corner of their head cauterize.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerates, then cauterize that with cauterizers which I have said, having paralyzed and softening of the body over the spines of the neck and the spines of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let the cauterizer be olive oil as prescribed.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is an infant, then pause cauterizer subtle according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of the cautery for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted by moisture and become flat and thick, then cauterize those parts with the cautery that we have called the paralytic.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excessive and declines into melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then give him water that cleanses his brain according to the water that has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the head of the patient, and make a proper incision on his head above the circle, and place your hand on that spot.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be seated, and be held in all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then place a liniment; and it is worthy of an ancient sheep's balm.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And scald that over the fire for warming, which the patient says hurts when it is too much in him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then put that in the middle spot of his head above the circle, and let him feel it until it is dissolved.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And give that sick person this medicine every week for the entire week until they are healed; or if you want, make small points with a pointed cautery according to the most appropriate place, but always have your hand on the patient's hand with a well-ordered cauterizer: this is a special cauterizer that moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then place your hand on that swollen part in green or gray wool.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of the descent of hot water into the hip.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it is declared to you that the beginning of hot water in the hip has started, then start and give the patient that which will make their head clear, and keep that away from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let that sweat in the bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command the patient to shake their head, and make points with that cauterizer at the middle of their head; and then make points with two cauterizers on two temples if it is the beginning of hot water in two hips, or on one side if it is the beginning of hot water in one hip.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Incise all the veins and arteries that are located behind the kneecap; and place the cautery in that far place on the side of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	Watch out for blood flow when it is being cauterized; and if you see blood flow from there, stop the bleeding with some medicine that is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And you will find the knowledge that is in the extraction of arteries and the puncturing of those and the precaution of blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	Some veins are cauterized in the neck behind two bones and two cautery devices are produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the cauterization of ancient tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the wound are very old and through the veins and arteries that are in the place manifest of the head and it is verified that such is excessive fluidity, then cauterize that one with the cautery that we have mentioned in the chapter on the beginning of water collection in the wounds, and with the cautery in the middle of the head and with two cautery devices in the neck behind two temples, and with two cautery devices in the neck behind two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if it is necessary to cauterize the wound in the entire length of the hair on the side of the forehead with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of cauterization for bad breath.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat that person who we mentioned in the division and have not yet perfected your treatment, then prepare and give to the patient three drops of laudanum; and after removing their head, cauterize the wound with a larger or smaller cautery made of olive oil.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that wound with a clover-shaped cautery on the two temples below the hair, a small one.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that person.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the shape of the clover-shaped cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauterization for relaxation of the eyelids.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is relaxed by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a crescent-shaped cautery; and this is its shape:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, using a pointed cautery, make points on the two superciliary ridges, extend them in all parts, and lengthen them from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the quantity of the superciliary ridge.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand too much against the cautery, but according to the quantity that the tense part of the eyelid is stuck.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of the eyelid cautery when the eyelashes are converted to parts and poke the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the eyelashes of the eyelid are converted to parts and poke the eye, cautery in those places according to two methods, either by fire or by medicine that burns.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you use cautery by fire, command the patient to open his eyes with those that clean those eyelashes as those that remove them, until they are extended and equal; and if he pokes that eye, then strengthen the eyelids of that eye with one bandage so that it is not injured until the eyelashes have grown.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	When they are born and weighed, pause the head of the patient in your hand, and then place your other hand on their eyelid, using a second finger to feel for the beginning of the pulse near the hair.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place a gentle touch on the eyelid or in the mucus of the eye over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then ignite the cautery that is used for this purpose.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize the figure that you have placed, in small steps, using a curved instrument, until the surface of the wound is burned, appearing as a thin layer of charcoal.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And it is customary for health to be restored from the work of the eye, that you raise the eyelid already contracted and the hairs of the eye elevated from the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and leave it there for three days, and then place your hand on the wound until the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then carefully cure that wound until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the eyelid returns to its original position and becomes soft again, then do the same with another pointed cautery as you did before.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the eyelids are in their original position and are equal again, then cautery that wound where it is naturally located and do not let the eyelids press on it.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But if the pointed cautery causes this pain that you command the patient to lift their eyelids and equalize them, then make a shape of folded cloth like a fan.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take some warm, live earth and mix it with those causes, and make that into a poultice so that it is not dispersed; and then spread that poultice on the cloth that was made like a fan, and place that over one of the eyelids; and then place the other eyelid on a soft, warm album, and the head of the patient should be elevated.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Pause the remedy over the affected area and press it gently, but do not let the patient feel the bite of the remedy, as the bite is like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Therefore, if the initial bite is too strong, remove the remedy and apply a new one; when the bite stops, remove the remedy and wash the affected area with clean water; then consider whether the eyelid has been lifted as it was during the injury, due to fire or incision, as it is now; and if not, return to the previous remedy on the area where the remedy has not been applied and does not cause discomfort until your operation is complete and the wound is closed.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then press over the wound and wait until the pus from the infection is completely drained, and then cure it with a definite or other remedy until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary for you to keep constant vigilance during your operation that the remedy does not fall out of the wound, and if the eyelid becomes soft and there is some cause of the hairs in the wound, then repeat the remedy on the area where the eyelid is soft, as you did at the beginning, and continue until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the way to perform the operation of intubation.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you should know that the necks of men are varied according to their size and sensitivity, and therefore your contraction is made accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not cover the correct way to that one who is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	About the cauterization of a fistula that is in the lacrimal duct of the neck.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap. le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be hollow, like a cane or pen of wax, at one end of which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see, it goes deeply into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want to come out, do so with a tent.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But it is better to leave those that are concave as they are in the work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and drain the pus and dry that.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and remove the pus from there.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place your hand over the area where the cautery is burning hot, and take away that part of the cauteries from the side of the nose, so that your hand or the patient's hand is not burned, and then place the cauteries in the gray matter and corrupt that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of the cautery it goes through the bone, so be it; and if not, then repeat the cauteries once or twice, depending on the case; and leave that area for three days, and then place your hand over that area and surround it with a dry bandage until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol. And another method for cauterizing a fistula, which was first described: insert the needle into the location of the fistula and feel that and then place a cushion in that slight cavity where the shape of the needle is; and then put a quantity of one uncia of lead on it; and with your hand make a good retention, and do not let the patient be harmed by the lead so that it does not reach the bottom of that; and cover that over with album of egg or water, where the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it through wonderful healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with that which we have said about cauterization and healing, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer a tract of snail and reduce the fistula to the body according to its own location when it comes.

Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the uvula or on the palate or on the teeth, an abscess occurs and then a blister forms, and then it bursts, and then it becomes old, and then you cure it with a cauterizing iron and it becomes a fistula, and then you cure it without expanding your cure, then cover that you ignite the cauterizing iron according to the amount that is reabsorbed in the fistula, and then put that ignited iron in the throat of the fistula, and then you place your hand inside until the hot iron reaches the edge of it, and then on the other side make a small cut or two; and then cure it with the method we have mentioned for the cure until it is healed.

Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cautery of teeth and the softening of jaws.

When the jaws are softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and those medicines do not cure them, then place the head of the patient on your lap, and hold the cauterizer in the shape that will come to you, as if you were holding a quill over the tooth and inserting it into the jaw, and you will feel the heat of the fire at the tip of the tooth when the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and repeat the cauterizer several times as you wish.

And then the patient opens his mouth with salt water and holds it for an hour, and you can feel that, because the decayed tooth is closed, the softened jaw is strengthened, and the moisture that corrupts is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of the cautery for tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc. Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Using the edge of cows' horns is that you take the edge of cows' horns and blow it into the hot iron, and then take a cotton and wrap it around the end of the tent, and then immerse that with the edge of the horn, and place it on the painful tooth quickly until it is cooled.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat that several times until the power of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.

De cauterizacio del stomac.	Of cauterization of the stomach.

De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	Of cauterization of the foot.

Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	Of puncturing abscess of the foot with a pointed cautery.

When there is an inflammation or abscess in the foot and you want to know if that abscess is in the flesh of the foot or in its tunic, if it is in the flesh of the foot, the patient feels increased heaviness and pain.

And do not use this form of cautery unless that one which is studied in the art of medicine and has been proven to cause fewer complications; but this one has been tried for some time on this operation, but it is better to leave it alone and choose another.

De cauterizacio de plauresi.	Of the cauterization of the soles.

De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	Of the use of cautery in fistulas that are formed naturally in the body.

And cover the wound with a nutrient according to the length of time of its treatment, which should be placed on the patient's abdomen, and that the intestine does not come out due to the effort of healing.

E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And be careful of work and replenishment of food and drink, and of violent vomiting, because when using this regimen of healing, the whole person is healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I direct the treatment of ruptures in other parts of the abdomen, and at the beginning, and so that they do not move, then cauterize the rupture with a red-hot iron according to the amount of it, and that which is extracted from the coda is like the clean part of it; and then take care of that which we have said, and do not adjust it.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And then the first doctors said that a rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery of this form, rather than with a needle.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And a line is placed on the side of the rupture that is closest to the latitude, and another line on the other side; and your hand with a claw-shaped cautery, but the first cautery is thinner and better.

De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the cautery of leprosy.

Comensa la segonda partida.	Begins the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and puncture and bleeding and of leeching and of wounds and of their similarities.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.
