Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	However, if you fear, place it under the incision in the area above the elbow, or under the elbow in Egyptian oil, or in any of the oils that are green, because when those ligaments harden, and the bones are separated from their position, the pain is relieved.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	If there is a large bone like those of the backbone or cushion or similar to those, and that which is corrupted from it is only the surface of it, then remove that resin only behind where that blackness and corruption is, and then restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	If that which is corrupted from it is a large part, and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that and that entirely incise into the area where the corruption reaches, and then cure it before it becomes consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend that you have someone who has experienced this in the patient's thigh to hold and assist during your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	A young man around the age of thirty, who experienced pain in his thigh, and from the parts that were putrid was on the matter of the body inside where the matter reaches the thigh, and it is a large abscess, and not from an external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then the doctor extended the fire too close to the affected area before the abscess was opened, and the matter that came out of it was stopped by the doctor's hand, and the cure was stopped by the doctor's hand before the bed became fistulated, and the pus in the wounds all poured out and the humidity of the wound.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And then all the doctors treated him for about two years, and the fire was not in that place but in the arm, until I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina. E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I introduced the tent into one of those wounds and reached the tent to the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then I examined quickly those wounds and found that they had reached all parts of the bed.

And then I showed and incised over one of the wounds those that had entered before describing a part of the bone, and at once I found that it was rotten and corrupted and decomposed; and already a part of the bed had penetrated into the muscle.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And you should have already discovered and prepared that which was hidden under the bone.

E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	Then place your hand over the wound with consolidating medicine for a long time, and it is not consolidated.

E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat. And then you should have discovered another way and not ceased to gradually incise the bone particularly and perform the restoration of it, and it is not restored until you have incised around a palm of it, and that extracted was its marrow, and then you should have restored it with medicine, and it was consolidated and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And repetition is not necessary in the operation of cutting off the limb and the limb itself, but for the disposition of the lady's maid and the scarcity of her tolerance and fear of death, which often occurs in all hours due to excessive evacuation of bad blood.

And then healing is for the entire cure, and nothing is in place of hard meat; and it is good to position him in his own body and restore his strength; and he is treated according to his positions and does not do anything contrary to him in ambulation or cause any harm in any case.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	And if the limb is in place of the body already rotten, then proceed with this method: and that you take a bandage and strength at the end of that limb, and command whoever stretches it; and pause that bandage of thick wool from the first bandage; and bring it over the flesh that is left of the bone, and extend the outside of him to draw the flesh to the parts left, and you uncover the flesh over the place which you want to sew so that the stitch does not hurt the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	When the table is placed incorrectly next to the bones, it is not forbidden to use a saw that does not dry out the rotten flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And cover the sawing on the rotten area little by little, because if it is in the hollow of the corruption and does not appear at the surface, then another method must be used.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is rotten and not eminent, then continue sawing from one continuous piece to another, and the corruption is in the middle or in a separate piece, then remove all the flesh from all parts; and place a cushion behind, and use the saw of the first piece where the corruption is continued until the sawing of the other piece is complete.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And if the sawing is done according to the location of the corruption, then do it a little, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is at the joint, then insert the saw into the rotten joint and saw the bone where the other piece continues.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then do not saw in the ratio but rather in a straight line.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	If the corruption is in the breast or foot, it is difficult; however, try to find the corruption in whatever way it appears to you, and remove it, and wash it according to each disposition that is possible for you, and let everything be corrected to you, when not against your will comes blood or nerves.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	You should know what are the sawblades and the saws to cut these bones, according to the position of the bones, and the preparation of those, and the size of those, and the subtlety and greatness and parvity of those, and their hardness and rarity; therefore try to prepare all kinds of instrument suitable for that operation.

You should know that that operation means to you regarding the specific instrument that is needed; when you are great in study and long and knowledgeable of the ways of this art, and testimony of the ways of illnesses, therefore you have already chosen that which is suitable for you from all the instruments for that illness.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And you will form in the end of this chapter the number of instruments that you will use simply and easily, which you will process according to your prohibition, which you will experience on the others.

De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of the ends of cutting tools and the sawing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	When the extremities are affected either intrinsically or extrinsically, or when you have treated that corruption for the cure of those medicines and the cure does not come, or when the corruption leaves the member that was not affected by any cause, then it is necessary to insert that member into that part of the body where the corruption is, so that the patient might escape from that part of the body that causes more harm to the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the cause of that is that the member becomes black before it is properly cooked, or if it becomes rotten near where the fire has burned, or if it is affected by a disease that has spread throughout that member and has taken over the whole body; therefore, I advise you to insert that part into that place.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	Similarly, if the corruption is caused by the pressure of certain poisonous causes such as a scorpion's sting or from a viper or a rattlesnake and similar creatures.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or pressure is in the extremity of that member, then you should insert that member and not give space to the corruption so that it does not enter into the body.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if you approach the patient's face, then insert a cushion under their cheek, and do not give space for corruption until they take hold of the cushion in their arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you insert that one, then insert your arm into the space at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if corruption passes around the joint, then that is the death of the patient; and in treatment, give another cause or that one to increase its effectiveness.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, if corruption passes into the foot, then insert that one into one of the toes.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold of the toe, then insert the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it can enter the ankle, then insert the cushion into the joint of the ankle.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if corruption has already reached the ankle, then in that case, there is no hope, and let the patient die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the method of inserting the member or cutting it is that you strengthen the skin in the part that you want to insert, and strengthen another skin over the area; and extend the minister a skin to the parts behind, and extend the minister another skin on top; and you separate the flesh that is between two skins at least one span wide until all the flesh is discovered; and then insert or cut.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And let there be placed cloth of all parts to prevent it from touching the wound, and bring the patient's injury and abscess carefully.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	If there is bleeding when working, then cauterize the wound continuously, or place some powders to stop the blood; and then return to your medical practice until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bandage the affected member with a suitable bandage, and treat it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend that you be aware of this event that happened to a man in his foot, which is the accident you and I have recommended, which occurred due to the blackening of his foot from an injury that was similar to burning by fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption first occurred in his toe within a short time.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepared for himself more than the cure to go to the member with the urgency of its pain and burning, and he did not cut that foot into the joint, and it was healed.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time, it often happens to that woman in the mentioned place, corruption in the said uterus.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it comes to me, and I perforate that excess fluid that was placed on the surface of the medicines, approaching the purification of the body; and if the excess fluid is not repelled, it begins to go into the other part where it begins in the uterus.

And he calls me to incise the uterus of that woman, and I do not want to do that hoping for the reflection of that excess fluid, and more than he fears death from the incision of the uterus, because the virtue of the patient was weak.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he was disappointed with me, he returned to his land and reached me that that man prepared and incised his entire uterus, and was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not added this narrative except to be helpful for that which is caused by this illness, and to have meaning for the one who understands it and to be done according to that meaning.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the treatment of sinuses and the quality of clutterization with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When abscesses occur in fleshy members and the space of the abscess extends until it collects pus, and then it is broken and perforated, and the pus is drained from it, and the place remains open as if it were a vessel, and the codena that is above it is covered with thin cloth, and it does not reach deep corruption, and it does not press on bones or nerves or ligaments, it is called a sinus, and it is not called a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space extends until the corruption presses on some member, then it is called a fistula and does not heal.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment of it is to insert that codena entirely with a revolving motion, and more when it is thinned and made with cloth, and you make sure that it does not stick to the place due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	However, if you hope that the codena will stick and that the corruption has not reached deep consequence, and in the codena there is a break, then you treat it with a clutterization.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And consider the sinew, and if it is large, and the brace that you have made from fat has a strong odor, then cleanse it with the Egyptian medicament which is made of oil, vinegar, and zinc, and divide it into equal parts, and place it in a vessel, and boil it over the fire until the medicament becomes honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	Then take that which is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; cleanse the sinew with that, strengthen its orifices, and leave the medicine on it for the amount of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	Then extract that which is left; and do this for so many days until the sinew is cleansed and remains moistened.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And some waters are cleansed with ash water, when you are not present this medicament; and you should take the ashes of wood, and place them on the water; and then collect that and cleanse it with that inside until you confirm that the sinew is ready.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	If the patient does not tolerate the Egyptian medicine or the water of ashes, then make a clyster with honey and charcoal mixed together, and make a clyster with honey alone, because honey is moistening and cleansing, and it makes the sinew adhere, and especially when there is an excess of stupefying and drying in the water.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And if you have done this for some time and feel that the sinew has been reunited, then make a clyster with water that makes the flesh soft in it.

E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then apply the meat according to your method, and repeat if necessary.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	In the wind that is administered in the disease of pleurisy, without a verge transverse or opening, and it is not administered except that it be filled with water, and placed on the member only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the form of it: And this windmill, the larger it is, the better, so that it can receive a large amount of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter 97.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Bloodstains are not administered to any members except in the members where it is not possible to position windmills, such as those with gums and similar parts; or in a member denuded of flesh, such as the nose and similar parts.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that you have found bloodstains that are in the waters of polluted rivers.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then lay them in the day and night in water that is not polluted, and that does not cause any harm in the belly of those; and then evacuate the body with a fleubotomy and windmills; and then apply pressure to the patient's member until it becomes red; and then place them on top of it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and ready.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	If it is possible to see the wound from the inside, it is better to do so through a small incision.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	If not, then wash the wound with warm water and a lot of it; then rinse and express it.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the body is prolonged, then bring the cloth of the bandage to the wound, and place it underneath where the blood is flowing.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the wound is multiplied, then powder it with trisulphate of vitriol or gallic acid and similar substances to stop the bleeding until the wound is stopped; or place the most matured beans on the wound, and leave them there until the beans stick to the wound, and then the wound is stopped.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if necessary, change the bandages when possible.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the bandages are not allowed to be suspended, then wash the wound with fresh blood or insert a needle into the places where the blood is flowing; and place them there, so that when they feel any blood soon afterwards.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to open, sprinkle some powdered asphalt, salt, or ash on those areas and quickly cover them.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Now begins the section of the text about treatment.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is necessary in the art of medicine; and it is the treatment of fracture and accidental displacement of bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh son, be wise and know that fools claim to know about this chapter; the common doctors and the vulgar, and those who sometimes do not read the books of the Ancients or understand one letter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason this method of the sciences in our land is hidden; and I have not done so at any time; and I have not admitted anything that follows, but by the length of reading the books of the Ancients and studying their understanding, until I extracted the science of those.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then direct yourself to experiment and study throughout your life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described all of that in this chapter, which contains the greatest science and on which I have passed the longest experiment; therefore, I will not reveal it to you or remove it from its occupation of length; and I will show it to you at the end of the revelation; and I will demonstrate it in this way: in the form of the instruments that are administered in that, as is done by addition of declaration, as I have done in two previous chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter one.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections from the fracture of bones, from those that are necessary to mention before we begin the memory of broken and diverse members of each one.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us say in the prologue of this chapter the summaries of the speech; and the chapters to which understanding is given by those who begin them on the truth of those; so it is you and others who know or learn this noble art from others.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore say that when something happens to someone with fracture or dislocation or torsion or impaction, then you should begin with fluoroscopy or X-ray of that one, or any other way, if no cause prohibits it, as if the power is weakened, or it is the one on which something happens, or old in decrepitation, or it is time of great heat, or of great cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then be content with seeing fresh herbs and meat of birds and of crabs; and prohibit thick meats and fill with foods and all food that fills the veins of sanc, as long as you are sure of apostema caut, and if you do not fear effusion of matter to the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their first regular position, which is usually where they were before.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And as the bone begins to be restored, then feed the patient with nutritious foods that are heavy and thick in nature, such as their food made of wheat flour and water, and rice, and caps, and peas, and stomachs of cows, and hooves, and fresh fish, and large and similar meats, and this regimen is made by coagulation of fracture more gently and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that bones can only be healed and consolidated according to their nature by the drying of their members, which is not possible in men who are in their prime and in the elderly.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are healed and consolidated according to their nature for all time by the drying of those members, and those that are from them at the end of leniency, such as the bones of small children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	May nature adjust and anoint over the broken bone of each part, some cause similar to glue in which it is thickened that adheres and strengthens that entrance which is conglutinated and united together, through which venom of fortitude and firmness flows, as with fire at the beginning, through which no cause prevents it from completing its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this cause it is necessary to place the bandages on the patient's wounds, bandages in which there is heaviness and viscosity and thickness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Great variety of fracture according to the difference of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And you will know that the types of fracture are different according to the difference of the limbs, for the fracture of the bone of the chest is different from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the chest is different from the fracture of the bone of the back; and similarly all other members are different among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I have remembered the knowledge of all types of fracture, explained in its separate chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Great variety of fracture in this case.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	There is great variety in the types of bone fractures in these cases; some are caused by arcs, others by stars; and some are caused by the length of the bone: and some fractures are due to the stage and stars and additions that proceed or do not proceed, as is done when preparing to write, and there is a fracture with a wound and disruption in the head, and a small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And in each case, there is a specific pain that accompanies the restoration of the bone after its distinct memory returns to its places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Great difficulty in bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And for that reason, bone fracture is known by the following signs: the twisting of the bone, and its swelling and pain to touch, and when it is understood that it is broken at your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore, when there is no twisting in the location and it is not made by touching the bone at its movement and the patient does not feel great pain, then it is not a fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that there is twisting or a small fissure, where you may not be able to hold it with your hand and compression of all; then place something over it from the medicines of which you remember at that moment, appropriate for the location; and keep it straight by a subtle restriction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	You should know that the location when it is bent and not split into two or another, what does not occur in its entire part of the body, then cover it from your hour to the rectification of the hand that occurs at the postema caution.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if it occurs at the postema caution, then leave that for several days until it ceases; and then equalize that second according to each method that you can of lightening and of engineering.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	You should know that the restoration of it and the adjustment of it is lighter than the bone in which the accident occurs in the body.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then apply that second when the memory of it comes.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if in the bone there is an accident, then it is necessary to extend this member broken from two parts, whether the hand or the foot; or your hand if the member is small; or two cords or one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And position your hand on the member in a way that is equal to its natural shape, while the parts of the member are stretched out, then pierce those additions and return them to their places according to each manner that you can in their locations.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And be careful not to injure the patient or cause any harm during your operation; and pierce according to your ability, applying one bone to another as a companion according to the best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And consider whether in that hour you touch your hand at the right moment, and if you see any different cause here, correct it and equalize it according to the quantity of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid excessive extension and compression, as foolish doctors who move their hands too much cause pus to accumulate around the patient's operation, or they cause contraction in the member, as we have seen in their foolish movements.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And approximate anatomy, approximate equality and proper operation and structure of that member, and rest and tranquility; advise the patient on that and make him understand that he should not move that in the hour of his watch and sleep, and see his rotation and agitation, and determine his excretion, and determine all his movements for the whole of his virtue; and wait until the position of the member is a position in which pain is secure, which causes that when it is in the disposition of the position of the member or injury; then consider whether you should change that to another disposition of that in which he does not feel pain; and guard against that because the position of that member is straight and equal, so that the member does not suffer tortuosity when restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the fracture of the limb is as I have recommended; because you know that broken limbs vary in their location, size, and shape.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small, like the arm and the wrist and similar to them, then it is recommended that the covering be made of very fine cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But for those that are large, like the buttock or the thigh, then it is recommended that the covering be made of strong and durable material, because the laxity of such a large limb can cause it to dislocate entirely, unless it is kept in place.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then begin, with your equalization of pressure, place a suitable bandage over the location of that fracture, three or four times as the limb becomes more stable; and strengthen your hand gently on the bandage.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then proceed to the deepest part of the location of the fracture, and strengthen it gently so that your structure does not tear the location of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then gently extend your tongue into the area around the fracture, gradually softening the structure until you feel a large part of it.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap it around the other affected area over the location, and gradually apply the bandages to the part behind the fracture; and your operation should be in the structure of the bandage and the softening of the second one that we mentioned in the first bandage.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then place your hand between the bandages at the top of the lion or cloth that is equal to the tortuosity of the fracture, if there is tortuosity in it; and if not, do not place your hand in it for any reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then place your hand on the other bandage, and gently equalize it with these pointed bandages as soon as possible, if there is no inflammation or abscess in the location; and then place your hand on that which secretes the abscess and which removes the inflammation; and leave that for several days; and then strengthen it with those.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And if the cane of the master is made of laurel wood, and well formed; or of pine; or of palm fronds; and let the width of each rod be according to this form and figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, the nail that is placed over that fracture should be thicker and longer than the other nails, and the length of the rod according to how it is applied to the member in magnitude and evenness; and strengthen the other end of the rod with another bend according to your first structure; and apply the iron decently above as we have said of the structure, and that your structure should be according to the location of the fracture, and the longer it is from the fracture, the less the structure.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And that the threads should be thin and even in thickness, and of good quality; and if the threads are thick, as I have seen by the operation of some folk pulling the thick threads of cords of the liver, and it is a great error when the structure is not equal.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And it is not convenient to use very thin needles, because you will not be able to grasp the things you want with them, and you do not want there to be a distance of one ditch between each needle.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is led to the edge of the bed by the extremities of the stirrups, then place your hand under their head and do not let them fall off the bed.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some fractures are very painful, and disruptions occur in the spine, and you will find memory in that one in the second particularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And you should know that all broken limbs are not straightened on the first day; the reason for this is that the limb, when it is large, does not want to be placed on the stirrups but rather after five days or seven or more, according to your safety of the occurrence of an abscess.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the way of the plasters that the Ancients restored to, which are placed on fractures and dislocations and torsion.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Hand of the splint like a restoring device for fractures, suitable for various complexities and especially for women and children, because it is over which no heat or moisture: and you should take powder from milled grain, and the medium of the flour that you can move the bone in the parts of the mill.

E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And you should make these medicines into powder that is ground on the surface, such as they are dry; and generally, administer all of this medicine of property of which is to remove and not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And guard yourself second that the wound in your cure is not nettle; and it is not in the swelling of the tongue or other; nor do you allow to add virulence to it; because when it is adjusted on the linen of the brain, corrupts that and poisons that, and occurs on the patient that malice malignant.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And occurs in the socket of the head, as of which is modified the bone and more when it is pressed on the cure of it, and is blackened on the surface of it; and therefore consider that occurs on the patient the accidents that we have said, know that it is paralytic its whole.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	If no black magic occurs but rather medicine that is placed above, and it is by the power of that medicine that it causes the black magic, then cover that part with honey and four parts of roasted oil, and place a cloth on it, and place that over the affected area; and cure it with the appropriate remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	You should know that the nose is not broken in two parts simultaneously, or one of those some veins, because there are two bones, and the part that is left is cartilaginous, and it is not broken and does not suffer from attrition and tortuosity and sinusitis.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts is broken, then cover that part with the same nose, and match that fracture with the other side, and with the other side, until the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And do this to help you, and remember not to cause harm to the patient during your operation.

E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then do the same thing.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut. E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And insert a piece of cloth into the nostril, if the fracture is in one part, or place two splints, if the fracture is in two parts, and let it cover the entire width of the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And say to the ancient restorers that the splints should be covered in bandage, and they should be changed every day, but I have not seen this done; having covered it with a piece of album made from honey and powdered mullein; and then leave it until the bone is set and the cartilage is strengthened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	Some splints should be inserted into the nose, in place of the calcium, or else it would be wrapped in a cloth of lion's skin; and that the fracture of the nose is more severe and that the patient is not prohibited from breathing.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	This cause is not necessary for you; and if you want, do that, and if you want, make splints.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another splint is needed, apply it to the nose with wax or cotton soaked in warm water and rose oil, or with diphtheria.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	However, if no splint is needed, then cover that deformed part with flour of mustard and powder of lentils mixed with egg white; and place a cushion on the lion's skin, and do not press the nose for any reason.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	However, if the bones of the nose are broken or fractured slightly, then cover them with that, and extract those with instruments that are suitable for those; and place this cut, and heal that with what encases and consolidates, and with ointment that is suitable for that.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	If a person has difficulty breathing due to a blockage in the nose, then apply heat to that area and administer a tube of warm liquid to help them breathe completely.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter 4.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	On the treatment of the jaw when it is dislocated.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken but the fracture does not cause pain, and if the fracture is only slightly deformed and not completely separated into two pieces and is not curved to the sides, then it can be treated without surgery.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is in the middle, then insert your finger in the patient's mouth on the left side; and similarly, if the fracture is on the right side of the jaw, then insert your finger on the right side of the patient's mouth; and push against the broken part of the fracture with your other hand from the deformed part of the bone; and keep that position until the fracture is healed.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu. E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to rest and remain calm, and place a lion's tooth on the wound.

E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then with this annex and adjust that bandage on it, and the disposition of the bone is not altered, leave that until it is healed and strong the fracture; for this fracture is stretched in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another complication occurs, such as an abscess, then administer the medication we have mentioned for other complications during their rest to heal it and let that abscess remain.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is complicated by the separation of the bone or the fragmentation, then consider whether it is necessary to remove those fragments and use a suitable remedy for removing them from the instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the openings of the wound are too narrow, then use a suitable amount of forceps according to your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And when you have removed those fragments and they do not remain, then if the openings of the wound are still too wide, then use one of the suitable bandages that would fit well in that area until it heals.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of the restoration of the clavicle when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	The clavicle is often broken at the part where it joins the shoulder, and that fracture is made in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	When it is broken, or separated, or separated into two parts, other than those that do not require surgery; and it is easier to restore; or if there are any complications in the surgery, and it is difficult to restore; or if the fracture is infected.

Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	But if you feel that the bone of the furcula and its muscle are broken, then have those parts removed to facilitate the healing.

E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And its shape is similar to a cue with which this is the hollow; and its width should be according to that which you need from it, according to the size of the bone or the softness of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	When the length of it is as long as possible for the operation; there should be two extremities with times, and one extremity should be wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the wound that you have incised when you have extracted the bone's suture is wide, and it is sure of pus, then adjust both sides of the wound with stitches.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is narrow, or you fear pus, then fill the wound with dressings and powders according to the amount of the wound's incision.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if pus occurs, then pour in dressing in very hot water and rose oil, and place it over that.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	May the structure of the bone when it is wounded and cut, be that you place an ointment made of flour of wheat and album of egg on it, and place it over that, and then place the sphere behind the tip of it, if necessary, and then take humidified linen, which is long enough, and its width is about a palm or around that; and then place powdered duplicates over the ointment; and then place a thin tablecloth of the width of three fingers and lengthwise similarly; and then wrap that in dressing, and then place that dressing with the tablecloth in the location over the location of the fracture; and then place humidified linen there as it is revolved, and revolve it around the neck of it and behind the tip of it, and reduce it over all parts, and when the structure of the fracture is covered with structure descent, and that is what is not hidden from you.

And even if the bone above the broken one is not fractured; and so that you can see the patient every day, when the bandage is softened or you see that the bone has been reunited, then you should straighten it and strengthen the ligament.

Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	On the treatment of a broken shoulder joint.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The spatula is broken in the wrong place, not in the patient's body, but on its edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	When the spatula is broken in the wrong place — and it is broken in the right place — and it is not known except by touch, then according to the shape of the fracture, prepare the patient and reduce it to its natural form in any way possible.

If the thin layer is concave in any of the locations of the spatula, then you level that concavity with lemon juice, and then place the layer according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then apply strength above with long blood from the constriction of the wound and firmness of the layer until it does not remain in its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc. E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And turn the patient on their left side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	The splint is restored in 10 days or in 25.
